entry.title: [WebIDL]

Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Pixel Slate only supports Widevine L3 and SD playback resolution
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem On the Google Pixel Slate 1. Start streaming Android app such as Netflix 2. Go to 'My Netflix' -> App Settings -> Diagnostics -> Playback Specification 3. Here you see the DRM showing Widevine 'L3', Version '16.0.1@003', Maximum Playback Resolution 'SD'
# Problem Description Google Pixel Slate still only supports Widevine L3, resulting in streaming services like Netflix only having a maximum playback resolution of 'SD' with their apps. This is not a Netflix issue, but it is a Google issue.
At time of writing, with Chrome OS and the Netflix Android app for example, we're not at Widevine L1 which will be able to support HD resolutions.
Does the product/development team at Google have any indication that this is on their radar to update to Widevine L1?
Widevine digital rights management (DRM) protects content across three levels of security, simply named L3, L2, and L1. The Pixel Slate needs to be certified to meet the full L1 specification to be able to stream HD and HDR content from services like Netflix.
Because it is not, we're only getting L3, resulting in a device as capable as a Pixel Slate only pumping out a max resolution of SD.
Widevine is a proprietary digital rights management (DRM) system developed by Google. The Pixel Slate is a device made BY Google. I'm not sure what's missing here, as to why the device cannot go through whatever processes is needed to be certified :/
Yes, there is a workaround to use the web version of Netflix, but this is not a solution, because the app offers a better UX and other features the web version cannot.
# Summary Pixel Slate only supports Widevine L3 and SD playback resolution
# Custom Questions #### Does this work in other browsers?
Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Audio / Video \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Implement "interest invokers" proposal
entry.content: Implement `interesttarget` and the default behaviour for popovers based on https://open-ui.org/components/interest-invokers.explainer/

entry.title: It has become really difficult to resize the window from the top since the Chrome Refresh 2023
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Try to resize the window from the top. You have to press your cursor exactly within the 1 pixel line of the top of the window. 2. Disable the chrome://flags/#chrome-refresh-2023 flag 3. Try to resize the window from the top. You can press your cursor within 4 or 5 pixels below the top of the window.
# Problem Description It has become really difficult to resize the window from the top since the Chrome Refresh 2023.
# Summary It has become really difficult to resize the window from the top since the Chrome Refresh 2023
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Experiencing chrome crashes since Nov '23. Chrome can crash up to 2-3 times per day
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Crashes happen unexpectedly 2. Usually while on Hangout 3.
# Problem Description Experiencing chrome crashes since Nov '23. Chrome can crash up to 2-3 times per day, usually while on hangout. Extremely frustrating for me, my team and stakeholders. When it crashes, I have to reopen Chrome, open the hangout and rejoin. When I rejoin I can see that I'm still on the Hangout but it's my Teams photo, that disappears after a couple of seconds.
# Additional Comments I was advised by techstep to: 1. Use Chrome Beta, 2. Disable / remove Chrome extensions, 3. Uninstall / reinstall Chrome. 4. Remove Voice Control.
# Summary Experiencing chrome crashes since Nov '23. Chrome can crash up to 2-3 times per day
# Custom Questions #### How much crashed? The whole browser
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: Crashes \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Chrome freezing and saved group tabs disappeared
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Opened chrome on a different device 2. Opened saved group tab 3. After several minutes, browser will freeze and I will be unable to do anything else on the. laptop 4. Need to force restart
# Problem Description Yesterday, I updated my chrome and was able to pull my saved group tabs from the bookmarks bar from another device. Later on that evening, chrome would freeze and I am unable to use other functions on my laptop and must force restart (happened around 4 times). Today, the saved group tabs in the bookmarks bar is disappeared but my freezing problem also disappeared.
# Summary Chrome freezing and saved group tabs disappeared
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [Extensions] Extend tabs.query() filter with optional documentId
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install extension with a content script and background 2. Open a tab (referred to as "tab A") 2. Send a message from content script of tab A to background and in background capture information about the sender 3. Go to any other tab, open a window, reload the tab, navigate away or do anything else to move away from tab A 4. In background attempt to query information about tab A document and find there is no reliable way to do so
# Problem Description This is a mirror of WECG issue: https://github.com/w3c/webextensions/issues/553
## Background
`tabs.query()` is not currently aware of tabs being navigated and moved around, so there is very little information to refer to the same document. Luckily, most use cases require querying info about the active tab, which happens to be the default behavior for this API. Unfortunately, some use cases require querying info about non-active tabs. Currently, the best way to match a document belonging to an inactive tab is to refer to its coincidental mutable non-unique attributes like its location (window id and an index on tab strip), its URL or title, which are problematic from privacy perspective.
## Problem
`tabs.query()` and other APIs under `tabs` are async and inherently racy. For example, the background may get a message from content script, call `tabs.query()` to get more information about the sender and receive a response containing information about a different document (because the tab may navigate between the message being sent and the `tabs.query()` being called).
## Proposal
Extend `tabs.query(queryInfo: QueryInfo, callback)`argument `QueryInfo` ([Chrome docs](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/mv2/reference/tabs#method-query), [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/Tabs/query)) to take optional `documentId` argument.
If developer specifies `documentId`, browser returns only the tab which currently hosts the corresponding document. If the provided `documentId` has invalid format, then an error is returned. If provided `documentId` is semantically valid, but browser is not aware of a document with this id, then nothing is matched so an empty array is returned (since this may be an id from an older browser session, tab open on a different device and synced via `storage.sync` or something like this). If the provided `documentId` corresponds to a sub-frame or a top-level frame currently sitting in BFCache, then nothing is returned to match existing behavior.
# Additional Comments Please assign to Chromium > Platform > Extensions > API
# Summary [Extensions] Extend tabs.query() filter with optional documentId
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Other browsers do not support this feature either.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Right clicking (contextmenu) in bookmark subfolders does not work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create a bookmark subfolder with at least 2 bookmark items 2. Right click on a bookmark item in the subfolder -> There is a 25% chance that the bookmark menu closes. 3. If the bookmark menu did not close, right click on a second bookmark item in the subfolder. -> There is a 100% chance that the bookmark menu closes.
And when the bookmark menu closes on a right-click, the contextmenu of the element behind the bookmark menu opens instead. (Which is often the webpage's contextmenu.)
# Problem Description There is about a 25% chance that the bookmark menu closes when a right-click on a bookmark item in a subfolder is executed. And a 100% on a second right click on a bookmark item in a subfolder.
# Additional Comments I can also reproduce this in Chromium version 124.0.6321.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit)
# Summary Right clicking (contextmenu) in bookmark subfolders does not work
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: updater_tests_system fails with GTEST_HAS_ABSL
entry.content:
This happens with https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5321837?tab=checks patched in. I haven't managed to figure out what's going on here.
Example of a failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/win-rel/515453/overview
As far as I can tell, these use a helper "test" to do things, and the helper "test" is failing. ``` [ RUN ] TestHelperCommandRunner.Run [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:prefs.cc(142)] CreateGlobalPrefs [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(48)] Trying to acquire the lock: {A6B9ECD5-772A-4D3F-BFEB-CF9340534A3E}: System [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(52)] Lock acquired: {A6B9ECD5-772A-4D3F-BFEB-CF9340534A3E}: System [11244:5640:VERBOSE1:prefs.cc(89)] UpdaterPrefsImpl (global): C:\Program Files\Chromium\ChromiumUpdater [11244:5640:VERBOSE1:prefs.cc(94)] ~UpdaterPrefsImpl: C:\Program Files\Chromium\ChromiumUpdater [11244:5640:VERBOSE2:lock_win.cc(74)] Lock released. [11244:5640:ERROR:integration_tests_impl.cc(918)] Value of: base::Contains( base::MakeRefCounted<PersistedData>( scope, CreateGlobalPrefs(scope)->GetPrefService(), nullptr) ->GetAppIds(), app_id) Actual: false Expected: true Stack trace: updater::test::ExpectRegistered [0x00007FF64990945E+382] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BE12+242] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BD8D+109] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BCEF+297] std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> >::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > [0x00007FF64979A7A7+425] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BC3B+117] base::internal::DecayedFunctorTraits<base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>,enum update [0x00007FF64979BB62+78] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(std::__Cr::basic_string<char,std::__Cr::char_traits<char>,std::__Cr::allocator<char> > const & __ptr64,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF649799F93+111] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(bool)>::Run [0x00007FF64979B9A6+438] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(bool)>::Run [0x00007FF64979BA97+679] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF64979937F+103] weak.AbslInternalReportFatalUsageError.default.?GetUsageConfigflags_internalabslYA?AUFlagsUsageConfig [0x00007FF64979708E+18430] updater::App::RunTasks [0x00007FF6499E1710+270] updater::App::Run [0x00007FF6499E15E6+34] updater::AppInstallWinHandleInstallResultTest_TestCases_Test::`scalar deleting destructor' [0x00007FF649791CE5+277] ```
``` [ RUN ] TestHelperCommandRunner.Run [16956:7384:INFO:integration_tests_impl.cc(946)] Run command: "C:\b\s\w\ir\out\Release_x64\updater_test.exe" --uninstall --enable-logging --vmodule=*/components/winhttp/*=1,*/components/update_client/*=2,*/chrome/updater/*=2 --system [10272:9832:INFO:server.cc(86)] Handle request at path:/update [10272:9832:ERROR:request_matcher.cc(88)] Failed Request content match failed. ``` [ RUN ] TestHelperCommandRunner.Run [4932:7940:ERROR:integration_tests_win.cc(299)] Expected equality of these values: is_installed Which is: true RegKeyExistsCOM(root, GetComServerClsidRegistryPath(clsid)) Which is: false Stack trace: updater::test::ExpectInstalled [0x00007FF691EA9A7B+7531] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope)>::Run [0x00007FF691CF9DFF+233] base::RepeatingCallback<int __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope)>::Run [0x00007FF691CF9D7B+101] base::subtle::RefCountedThreadSafeBase::Adopted [0x00007FF691CF9B9F+185] base::subtle::RefCountedThreadSafeBase::Adopted [0x00007FF691CF9C07+289] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(int,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF691CF9571+109] base::internal::DecayedFunctorTraits<base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScope,base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>,enum updater::UpdaterScope const & __ptr64>::Invoke<base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(enum updater::UpdaterScop [0x00007FF691CF94A5+69] base::RepeatingCallback<bool __cdecl(base::OnceCallback<void __cdecl(int)>)>::Run [0x00007FF691CF937F+103] weak.AbslInternalReportFatalUsageError.default.?GetUsageConfigflags_internalabslYA?AUFlagsUsageConfig [0x00007FF691CF708E+18430] updater::App::RunTasks [0x00007FF691F41710+270] updater::App::Run [0x00007FF691F415E6+34] ```
There were a number of other failures on other platforms that have since been resolved: - non-deterministic test harness failures due to specifying --gtest_filter on both the command line and --gtest_flagfile (this does not appear to be happening here) - command line parsing failures due to ABSL_FLAGS_STRIP_NAMES being implicitly set (this does not apply to non-mobile platforms, such as Windows)

entry.title: the media panel doesn't show the right video duration

# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create an HTML page, with a video element to video file 2. Open DevTools -> Media 3. Check the 'duration' property against the video player's duration
# Problem Description As per above - the video player displays a video to have a length of 58s, but the media panel shows 2 hours, 48 minutes and 58s.
# Summary the media panel doesn't show the right video duration
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Chrome not respecting imported certificate when expired
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. go to chrome://settings/certificates and import an expired cert 2. try to visit the site, you'll encounter not safe warning
# Problem Description I want Chrome to accept an expired certificate (signed by letsencrypt) for a specific site. I've downloaded the pem file, renamed it to crt, and imported it in Chrome. I can see the fingerprints and everything looks fine.
Only issue is interacting with the site still throws warnings such as certificate invalid. Other cases such as ERR_PROXY_CERTIFICATE_INVALID can't even be temporarily disable by for example by clicking Advanced->Proceed to ... (unsafe).
--ignore-certificate-errors works, but it's unsafe for ALL certificates, which is not what I want.
# Summary Chrome not respecting imported certificate when expired
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: Apps that use Android System Webview don't load their content
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Just load app that uses ASW e.g. Gmail - open specific e-mail and check if it will be loaded properly
# Problem Description Apps that use Android System Webview don't load their content - they are getting stucked on loadin e.g. Gmail when user tries to read specific e-mail message.
Of course I tried to clear memory (ASW and not working apps), checked Internet connection, security settings etc.
Many people also reported this problem when I put the opinion in Google Play store about ASW
Environment: Android 13, OneUI, Samsung S20 Ultra
# Additional Comments In my opinion urgent matter, because it blocks many everyday apps on Android
# Summary Apps that use Android System Webview don't load their content
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Can't open any website.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open Chrome. 2. Type any website address. 3. Get an error says "ERR_CONNECTION_RESET".
# Problem Description .69 version is fine. But after upgraded to .70, all tabs are cleared, and display a sad face with ERR_CONNECTION_RESET. Tried re-install and the result is the same. There must be something wrong with this version. Most funny thing is, it even can't open local address like router page 192.168.1.1.
# Summary Can't open any website.
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.content: simplified-bookmark-save-flow flag has been removed. This is a massive issue for chrome usability and user experience

entry.title: [Chromium GSoC] Request for Feedback (chromestatus)
entry.content:
*Instructions:*
*1) Choose if this is a general question about the project (if so choose template 1) or if this is a request for a review of a proposal (if so choose template 2 below)*
*2) Fill in the template completely and delete the instructions and the unused template*
*3) Update the title to reflect your question or "proposal submission for <your name>"*
*4) Submit and wait for the mentors to provide feedback*.
*--------------- Template 1 ------------------*
**Question about Project**
*Delete this and the below paragraphs and ask your question here, recall that there is lots of material for routine questions. Please go through the [project list](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/15tLikPVkKrkz53RVG1ncY-8PpWA4dgZU0-5kl-uB4dg/), if you are interested get started on the starter bugs / starter milestone listed on the project doc of each project.*
*If you want a head start or interested in contributing to chromium you can check out the “[Life of a Chromium Developer](https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/chromium-dev/c/ybLzH8-FoTc/m/YhTe2g9L7CUJ)”, “[contributing](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/contributing.md)”, or “[getting involved](https://www.chromium.org/getting-involved)” for information about getting the code and general flow of making a change to the code base.*
*If you have general questions not about a project you should instead email the mailing list chromium-gsoc@chromium.org (or file a bug with the [default template](https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/new?component=1515734&template=1947555)) and the admins can assist you.*
*--------------- Template 2 ------------------*
**Request For Project Proposal Review**
Please use our [template for a proposal](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IOj4hSdPl8h1-8zYK_Gt3OxA0R44SLbmr-ZH3f9yDXM/edit?usp=sharing)
But we also encourage you to read GSoC's [writing a proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/writing-a-proposal) and [example proposal](https://google.github.io/gsocguides/student/proposal-example-1). We suggest you reach out early engage with the starter bug of your project, and submit a proposal soon after you have a handle on the problem.
* Link to Google doc that contains your proposal: * Desired Project length (if different from project slide's suggestions): * Desired Project size (if different from project slide's suggestions): *Small/Medium/Large* * Any additional comments:

entry.title: WebRTC roll blocked due to missing default implementation of RtcPeerConnectionInterface::ShouldFireNegotiationNeededEvent
entry.content:
In webrtc https://webrtc-review.googlesource.com/c/src/+/340481, mock for webrtc::PeerConnectionInterface::ShouldFireNegotiationNeededEvent is added.
Unfortunately it breaks test RTCPeerConnectionHandlerTest.OnRenegotiationNeeded.
I suggest disabling this test, importing the latest webrtc and then fix the test.
See https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5322682?tab=checks

entry.title: Let's make native vertical tabs similar to edge or safari?
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. open chrome 2. cry
# Problem Description Let's make native vertical tabs similar to edge or safari?
current extensions with vertical tabs are terrible, they take up a lot of screen space, are not optimized, in the dark theme they have a white scroll(!) lol, and when you turn them on - horizontal tabs are not removed
# Summary Let's make native vertical tabs similar to edge or safari?
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title:
Tests are failing: tts_extension_apitest.cc(625): Value of: RunExtensionTest("tts_engine/update_voices_api")
 Actual: false
Expected: true
Failed 2 of 3 tests
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): tts_extension_apitest.cc(625): Value of: RunExtensionTest(\"tts_engine/update_voices_api\")\n Actual: false\nExpected: true\nFailed 2 of 3 tests
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/TtsApiTest.UpdateVoicesApi/ServiceWorker.0
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/0848341b103cf76930f0c9a6396e25d5
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Missing pen tablet input on ozone-wayland backend
entry.content:

entry.title: at times smooth scroll enabled elements do not scroll to correct position using scrollto
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. set behavior to smooth scroll 2. enter exact location to scroll to 3. scrollTop differes from provided position
# Problem Description works with firefox, works most of the time for chrome, not always
# Summary at times smooth scroll enabled elements do not scroll to correct position using scrollto
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A
